explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2512) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2512) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available - melting point: 122-123degC (Merck, 13th, 2001), test temperature: 140degC

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) of 920mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2001-34 (2002)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) of 1,000mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2001-34 (2002)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (RTECS (2004)): "Mild."

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (CERI-NITE Hazard Data 2001-34 (2002)): "moderate irritant."

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Category 1
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: based on the positive results in guinea pig skin sensitization tests based on the Maximization method described in CERI Hazard Data 2001-34 (2002), and classified as "skin sensitizer" by The Japanese Society for Contact Dermatitis.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, and negative data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests (dominant lethal tests), described in CERI Hazard Data 2000-34 (2002).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Cannot be classified due to lack of existing classification.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on the description in CERI Hazard Data 2001-34 (2002): No effects are observed in dams and their offspring. However, classification is not possible because of the absence of data on the reproductive toxicity to males.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "tremor, salivation, brown urine, abdominal position, achromia of the limbs and auricle, a decrease in locomotor activity focal hepatic necrosis associated with hemolysis caused by the administration of 3-aminophenol" (the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (2001)). The kidneys and spleen, in which the effects are also observed, are not considered as specific target organs because the symptoms are not severe and attributable to hemolysis. The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "brown-black urine due to methemoglobin in the urine" (the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (2001)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=447microg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003) and others.).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (BCF<40(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data, )), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 0%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 1.
